STUDENT SUCCESS HUB DOCUMENTATION
Set Up Contact and Case Page Layouts

Configure the Contact and Case page layouts in your Student Success Hub org.

Learn About Contact and Case Record Page Layouts
Student Success Hub includes default page layouts, compact layouts, and other assets for the Contact and Case objects. Review and customize these assets as needed for your school or institution. For example, you might want to change the fields in the highlights panel, or remove or add buttons.
Customize the Contact or Case Record Page Layout
To edit the page layout, such as to change the order of the fields, buttons, or related lists on the page, do the following.
Customize the Case Compact Layout
The compact layout controls which fields appear in the highlights panel at the top of the record page. If desired, add or remove fields from the Case compact layout.
Confirm the Contact and Case Layout Assignments
Whichever page layouts you're using for Contact and Case records, make sure they're assigned to the proper profiles.
Learn About Contact and Case Record Page Layouts

Student Success Hub includes default page layouts, compact layouts, and other assets for the Contact and Case objects. Review and customize these assets as needed for your school or institution. For example, you might want to change the fields in the highlights panel, or remove or add buttons.

In K-12 orgs, Student Success Hub provides these Contact and Case assets.

Contact object—The Student Support Contact Layout page layout, assigned to the support staff profile

Case object—The Student Record Case Layout page layout and Student Record compact layout, also assigned to the support staff profile

In higher ed orgs, Student Success Hub provides these Contact and Case assets.

Contact object

The Support Contact Layout page layout, assigned to the support staff and System Administrator profiles

The Contact Layout - Student page layout, assigned to the student profile

Case object

The Student Record Case Layout page layout, assigned to the support staff and System Administrator profiles

The Student Record compact layout, assigned to the support staff profile

The Case Layout - Student page layout, assigned to the student profile

NOTE For information about the Support Queue Case layout and compact layout, see Set Up Queue Management.
Customize the Contact or Case Record Page Layout

To edit the page layout, such as to change the order of the fields, buttons, or related lists on the page, do the following.

NOTE In orgs licensed and configured for student Users and Experience Cloud sites, we recommend displaying a minimal set of fields in the Case Layout - Student page layout so that students don't see more than they need to.

From Setup, in Object Manager, click the object whose layout you want to edit.
Click Page Layouts, and then click the page layout name.
Edit the layout and save your changes.

For more information, see Customize Page Layouts with the Enhanced Page Layout Editor in Salesforce Help.

Customize the Case Compact Layout

The compact layout controls which fields appear in the highlights panel at the top of the record page. If desired, add or remove fields from the Case compact layout.

From Setup, in Object Manager, click Case.
Click Compact Layouts, and then click Student Record.

Edit the layout and save your changes.

For more information, see Compact Layouts in Salesforce Help.

Confirm the Contact and Case Layout Assignments

Whichever page layouts you're using for Contact and Case records, make sure they're assigned to the proper profiles.

From Setup, in Object Manager, click the Contact or Case object.

Click Page Layouts, and then click Page Layout Assignment.

Click Edit Assignment.

Click Page Layout To Use and select the layout you want to assign.

Click the profile you want to assign it to and save your changes.

Let us know so we can improve!
